com.github.i49.hibiscus.validation

Interface ValidationResult


  • public interface ValidationResult
    A interface to inspect the result of the validation of JSON document.

    JsonValidator returns an object implementing this interface as result of the validation. This interface provides the following information for validator users.

    • JSON values parsed.

      getValue() returns the JSON value found at the root of the input JSON document including its descendant values. The classes representing the values returned by this method are all defined in JSR 353: Java API for JSON Processing.

    • Problems detected.

      getProblems() returns all problems against the schema found in the process of the validation. These problems returned are encapsulated as classes provided by com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems package. All problems which can be detected are listed on Problem page.

    The following code shows how to retrieve the JSON value found at the root of the input JSON document.

    
 ValidationResult result = ...;
 JsonValue value = result.getValue();

    The following code shows how to retrieve the problems detected in the process of the validation.

    
 ValidationResult result = ...;
 for (Problem p: result.getProblems()) {
   // handles each problem here.
   System.out.println(p.toString());
 }
    See Also:
    JsonValidator, Problem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<Problem> getProblems()
      Returns all problems detected in the process of the validation against the schema.
      JsonValue getValue()
      Returns the JSON value found at the root of the input JSON document including its descendant values.
      boolean hasProblems()
      Returns whether the validation detected any problems violating the schema in the input JSON document or not.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        JsonValue getValue()
        Returns the JSON value found at the root of the input JSON document including its descendant values. The classes representing the values returned by this method are all defined in JSR 353: Java API for JSON Processing. All the values under the root of the document can be retrieved through the API.
        Returns:
        the JSON value found at the root of the input JSON document which includes its descendant values.
        See Also:
        JSR 353: Java API for JSON Processing

      • hasProblems

        boolean hasProblems()
        Returns whether the validation detected any problems violating the schema in the input JSON document or not.
        Returns:
        true if the validation detected any problems, or false it detected no problems.
        See Also:
        getProblems()

      • getProblems

        List<Problem> getProblems()
        Returns all problems detected in the process of the validation against the schema. If there are no problems found, an empty list will be returned. Each kind of problems is encapsulated as a class which implements Problem common interface. These classes of the problems are provided by com.github.i49.hibiscus.problems package.

        All problems which can be detected are listed on Problem page.

        Returns:
        the list of problems, which never be null.
        See Also:
        hasProblems(), Problem
